ads.author: Dirk Smith Johnson
ads.title: Rare Williams OXO Pinball Machine
ads.description: Very rare Williams OXO pinball machine. Previously featured at the Roanoke Pinball Museum in Virginia. This is a unique electro-mechanical game that plays tic-tac-toe! This game has been in fully working condition until recently when it started blowing a fuse during game restart. It's most likely a switch contact somewhere that's broken, but I've been too busy to diagnose it, and I need the room, so I'm willing to sell it for less than I paid to someone who wants a unique game, and is willing to tinker with it. This game is basically in original condition except for being upgraded with $200+ worth of LEDs to make it brighter and more reliable.

ads.author: Allen Robinson
ads.title: P.O.W. Prisoners of War, Upright Arcade, SNK 1988
ads.description: Vintage Upright Arcade – P.O.W. Prisoners of War (SNK, 1988) Price: $325 Own a piece of late-80s arcade history! This is an original P.O.W. – Prisoners of War upright cabinet from SNK, released in 1988. Known as a classic scrolling fighter / beat ’em up, players battle their way through enemy compounds after escaping captivity. It’s a gritty, action-packed title that helped define the genre and remains a nostalgic favorite for collectors. Condition: - Cabinet is very old and needs a lot of love. - Boards need work and likely new caps. - Monitor powers on but the image quality is poor. - Lights come on. - No sound currently. - This is a project cabinet — ideal for restoration enthusiasts. Highlights: - Rare SNK beat ’em up from the golden age of arcades. - Upright cabinet with authentic late-80s design. - Great candidate for restoration or display in a retro collection. Important: - Sold as-is. - Serious buyers only. No I don’t deliver but it can be picked up or shipped (arranged by buyer) in Powder Springs, GA.

ads.author: Allen Robinson
ads.title: Police Trainer, Upright Arcade, P&P Marketing 1996
ads.description: Vintage Upright Arcade – Police Trainer (P&P Marketing, 1996) Price: $425 (Negotiable, but not by much) Test your reflexes and accuracy with this original Police Trainer upright arcade cabinet from 1996. Developed by P&P Marketing, Police Trainer is a fast-paced shooter that puts players through a series of training exercises — from target practice to reaction drills — making it one of the most unique skill-based arcade shooters of the 90s. Condition: - Cabinet is original but needs some love due to age. - Monitor powers on, image is good, but likely needs new caps for long-term reliability. - Lights and sound both work. - Controls function, but the guns need recalibration. - Sold as-is. Highlights: - Classic 90s shooter with training-style gameplay. - Upright cabinet design with dual light guns. - Fully playable — monitor, lights, and sound all working. - Great candidate for restoration or display in a retro collection. Important: - Price is $425, negotiable but only slightly. - Serious buyers only. No I don’t deliver but it can be picked up or shipped (arranged by buyer) in Powder Springs, GA.

ads.description: Vintage Upright Arcade – Pole Position (Atari/Namco, November 1982) Price: $475, Negotiable (but not by much) Step into racing history with this original Pole Position upright cabinet — one of the most iconic arcade racers ever made. Released in 1982 by Atari/Namco, Pole Position was a groundbreaking driving simulator that set the standard for racing games. It’s widely recognized as one of the Top 50 most historically important video games of all time. Condition: - Cabinet is very old and needs some love. - Boards need work and likely new caps. - Monitor does not power on. - Lights come on. - No sound currently. - This is a project cabinet — perfect for restoration enthusiasts or collectors. Highlights: - Classic upright racer with simulator-style gameplay. - Rare piece of arcade history from the golden age. - Great candidate for restoration or display in a collection. ads.description: Vintage Upright Arcade – Double Axle (Taito, 1990) Price: $400, Negotiable (but not by much) Bring home a piece of arcade racing history! This is an original Double Axle upright cabinet from Taito (1990). Known for its rugged off-road truck racing gameplay, Double Axle puts players behind the wheel of massive monster trucks, battling through dirt tracks, jumps, and obstacles. It’s a rare find that captures the excitement of 90s arcade culture. Condition: - Cabinet is original and shows its age — it needs some love. - Monitor has been converted to LCD. - Lights power on. - Sound is present. - Game plays and works! Highlights: - Classic Taito racing arcade with unique monster truck gameplay. - LCD conversion makes it easier to maintain. - Great candidate for restoration or display in a collection. - A working cabinet from 1990 — not something you see every day. Important: - Price is negotiable, but only slightly. - Sold as-is. - Serious buyers only. No I don’t deliver but it can be picked up or shipped (arranged by buyer) in Powder Springs, GA.

Lethal Enforcers: pretty much fully working, the only issues is the heavy damage to the cabinet itself, and the player 1 and 2 start buttons are broken and would need replaced, I just didn't get that far yet Sega Turbo OutRun: This one has a working screen (imaged removed) and does not boot at all. There's power too it though and there is visual but it's garbled graphics. Lock-on by data east: This one has a dead screen and does not boot at all with a hardware error 29. Cobra Command (inside an atari cabinet?): Has a dead screen and does not boot at all. There's power too it though. Looking to try to get $500 per cabinet but any reasonable offer would be considered. Looking to sell outrun and the monitor separately

P Game Modes: Features various game modes, including a "Split Score" mode where hitting a target increases the score, while missing halves it. Coin-op or Free Play: Can be set up for coin-operated use or free play, making it suitable for both commercial and home environments. Commercial-Grade Build: Designed for durability and heavy use in arcade settings or similar venues.

The game will let you play all the way through, just fine. But the screen has what they call monitor fog appearing on one side. The coin mechs work fine. Everything is all there. It has a brand new power supply, put in it.

ads.author: Nicole Aston
ads.title: Area 51 Atari Arcade Machine
ads.description: COME PICK UP! From the manufacturer: The 1995 video game Area 51 is a light gun shooter arcade game developed by Messa Logic and published by Atari Games. Players take on a role of a member of the Strategic Tactical Advanced Alien Response (S.T.A.A.R.) team, fighting against an alien invasion by the Akron and their zombie-like creations at the infamous Area 51 military base. The game was known for its use of digitalized video and sprites, and it was later ported to home consoles like the PlayStation, Sega Saturn and Windows. The machine does need SOME work. I’m not sure why though. It turns on, the screen is no longer visible, you used to be able to play it for a while, it has sound. Always wanted this machine and sad to see it go. Moved into an apartment and don’t have the room for it.
